title: Chinese scientists 3D print tiny items in half a second using holographic light fields scientists precision fabricate complex millimeter-scale objects in record time
summary: Chinese scientists have developed a technique for high-speed 3D printing of complex millimeter-scale objects in record time using holographic light fields, allowing for precision fabrication in a matter of seconds.
insight: Revolutionizing manufacturing with unprecedented speed and precision in micro-scale production

title: Netgear Nighthawk M7 5G Wi-Fi 7 mobile hotspot review Global eSIM marketplace is a game-changer
summary: The Netgear Nighthawk M7 mobile hotspot offers high connectivity with a price tag of $499, supporting up to 32 devices and both physical SIM and eSIM.
insight: Revolutionary eSIM capabilities transform global connectivity and roaming.

title: You can now file your G.Skill class action claim to get a cut of the $2.4 million settlement deceptive memory marketing class action now accepting payout submissions
summary: Eligible customers can file a claim for the G.Skill class action settlement, with submissions open until April 7, 2026.
insight: Affected buyers may receive a share of the $2.4 million settlement payout.

title: Microsoft s AI boss says AI can replace every white-collar job in 18 months We re going to have a human-level performance on most, if not all, professional tasks
summary: Microsoft's AI CEO claims AI models will replace humans in white-collar jobs within 18 months, achieving human-level performance in various professional tasks.
insight: Mass automation of white-collar jobs is near, reshaping industries dramatically.

title: Advanced Pentagon laser weapon shot down party balloons instead of drone by mistake, says report airport shut down after Customs and Border Protection mistakenly believed it was targeting Mexican cartel drones
summary: A Pentagon laser weapon accidentally shot down party balloons due to incorrect targeting. Customs and Border Protection mistakenly believed the laser was targeting Mexican cartel drones. The incident led to the shutdown of an airport.
insight: Government agencies' miscommunication can have unintended, chaotic consequences.

title: M5Stack AI Pyramid charms with translucent, RGB infused tetrahedral shell and $199 price tag but it is far more of an edge-AI appliance than a mini-PC
summary: M5Stack's AI Pyramid Computing Box is a mini-PC with a unique, RGB-infused design.
insight: Edge-AI appliance brings AI capabilities to IoT devices at an affordable price.

title: DXRacer Martian Pro Red Triangle review: Built for the fans
summary: The DXRacer Martian Pro is a feature-packed gaming chair with a premium price. It offers a comfortable and customizable experience, making it suitable for gaming enthusiasts. However, its high cost may be a barrier for some users.
insight: Premium gaming chairs cater to enthusiasts' high expectations and budgets.

title: Cloud storage company releases its 2025 hard drive reliability report overall Annualized Failure Rate drops to 1.36%, 21 percentage points lower than last year
summary: Backblaze's 2025 hard drive reliability report shows a 1.36% annualized failure rate, a 21 percentage points decrease from the previous year, marking its best result since 2022.
insight: Improved hard drive reliability reduces data loss and storage costs significantly.

title: Living neurons integrated into modern AI processing, claims SF startup biological computing power used to boost computer vision, generative video, and more
summary: A startup claims to have successfully integrated living neurons into its AI processing, using biological computing power to boost applications such as computer vision and generative video. The company has raised $25 million to further develop this technology. This approach could potentially replace or augment silicon computing in AI.
insight: Biological computing may outperform silicon in AI applications someday.

title: MakerWorld launches Copyright Protection Program to help 3D designers fight stolen files being resold online stamping out knockoffs is priority number one
summary: MakerWorld launches a free copyright protection program for exclusive designs. This service will combat intellectual property infringement on any online platform. The program aims to prevent knockoffs and protect creators.
insight: Protecting creators' rights prevents widespread counterfeiting and lost revenue.

title: Weathr app turns the Linux terminal into a live weather display background ASCII animated real-time weather show is powered by Open-Meteo
summary: Weathr app transforms the Linux terminal into a dynamic, real-time weather display using Open-Meteo's API, creating a mesmerizing ASCII art animation experience.
insight: Enhanced terminal experience with immersive, real-time weather visualizations.

title: Notorious 'Archive Today' website allegedly leads bizarre DDoS campaign against security blogger Wikipedia considers removing all links to the Archive
summary: Wikipedia considers removing links to Archive Today due to DDoS attacks. The 'Archive Today' website is allegedly involved in a bizarre DDoS campaign against a security blogger. This has led to a potential removal of links.
insight: Wikipedia's integrity threatened by DDoS attacks and alleged cyber threats.

title: Linux kernel 7.0 finally abandons the 28-year-old Intel 440BX chipset driver removal marks goodbye to the legendary motherboard chipset
summary: Linux kernel 7.0 removes the 28-year-old 440BX EDAC driver, marking a legacy end.
insight: Legacy driver removal simplifies kernel maintenance and reduces support needs.

title: Tiny Mac look-a-like alarm clock transformed to run real Mac software
summary: A vintage technology enthusiast repurposed a miniature Mac-like alarm clock into a functional Mac computer, showcasing creative innovation in upcycling retro technology. The device runs real Mac software and operates like a full-fledged Mac computer, highlighting the potential for repurposing vintage electronics. This project demonstrates the value of creative problem-solving and resourcefulness in technology.
insight: Reviving vintage tech can create innovative, functional devices with unique appeal.

title: "Like new" Ryzen 9 9900X3D Amazon order turns into a shocking CPU bait-and-switch scandal shopper duped in outrageous Ryzen 9 3900X scam
summary: A buyer was duped by a used Ryzen 9 9900X3D scam on Amazon, receiving a Ryzen 9 3900X worth $150 instead of the $530 CPU they paid for. The CPU was replaced in the box to deceive inspection and likely resold. The buyer got much less valuable silicon than they paid for.
insight: Counterfeit and resold CPUs undermine trust in online marketplaces and consumer protection laws.

title: Sony-led program offers PS5 rentals starting at $13.50 a month in the UK across 12, 24, or 36-month leases console has to be returned at the end of the contract
summary: Sony is offering PS5 rentals in the UK, starting at Â£13.50/month for 12, 24, or 36-month leases, with consoles to be returned at the end of the contract.
insight: New affordable option for gamers to access latest console tech.

title: Enthusiast scores watercooled dual Nvidia GTX Titan X GPUs for $86 $1,000 older flagship graphics card with custom water cooling for a bargain
summary: The user scores a bargain by acquiring watercooled dual Nvidia GTX Titan X GPUs in SLI for $86, a significant upgrade from their current GTX 1650 GPU. The custom water cooling setup suggests a well-planned and executed purchase. This upgrade offers improved performance and capabilities.
insight: Upgrading to dual high-end GPUs can provide substantial performance gains.

title: Intel fined $3 million by India s antitrust regulator over discriminatory CPU warranty policy says Intel abused its dominant position in the boxed processor market.
summary: Intel fined $3 million by India's antitrust regulator for discriminatory warranty policy. The policy was deemed unfair compared to practices in other countries. This ruling aims to maintain market fairness.
insight: Abuse of dominant market position harms global market competition fairness.

title: President's Day GPU bonanza brings RTX 5060 Ti 8GB back to $379 MSRP score a Blackwell GPU at MSRP, and get a free 650W power supply
summary: An RTX 5060 Ti 8GB GPU is now available at its MSRP of $379, offering a budget-friendly option for 1080p gaming. This deal also includes a free 650W power supply when purchasing a Blackwell GPU at MSRP. While the 8GB VRAM may impose limits at higher settings, it remains a viable choice for enthusiasts.
insight: Budget gamers can get high-end GPU performance at MSRP prices now

title: Ponzi schemer behind $201 million Bitcoin scam sentenced to 20 years in federal prison promised 3% daily returns on Bitcoin investments, left investors reeling
summary: A Ponzi schemer behind a $201 million Bitcoin scam was sentenced to 20 years in federal prison. The scam promised high returns, leaving investors reeling. The scheme's mastermind was held accountable for the financial damage caused.
insight: Unregulated Bitcoin investments can lead to devastating financial losses.

title: 7x increase in memory costs fueling price increases in ISP-provided routers, gateways, and set-top boxes home fiber rollouts may slow, and installations could become more expensive
summary: A 7-fold increase in DRAM costs is driving up prices for ISP-provided routers, gateways, and set-top boxes, potentially slowing home fiber rollouts and increasing installation costs.
insight: Rising DRAM costs threaten to inflate ISP equipment expenses significantly.

title: First PCIe 6.0 SSD enters mass production with 28GB/s speeds, 5.5 million IOPS, and liquid cooling Micron 9650 Series SSDs support air and liquid cooling
summary: Micron introduces the world's first mass-produced PCIe 6.0 SSD, the 9650 series, with speeds of up to 28 GB/s, 5.5 million IOPS, and liquid cooling capabilities.
insight: Massive storage performance boost for data-intensive applications

title: Budget RGB Fan Roundup: Are cheap PC fans always this bad?
summary: We tested 5 budget RGB fans for performance, finding no clear winner. One fan stood out as a clear loser. Results showed performance doesn't always match completeness.
insight: Cheap RGB fans may not deliver performance to match features

title: In a blind test, audiophiles couldn't tell the difference between audio signals sent through copper wire, a banana, or wet mud 'The mud should sound perfectly awful, but it doesn't,' notes the experiment creator
summary: Audiophiles couldn't distinguish between audio signals sent through copper, banana, or wet mud. The experiment challenged the conventional wisdom on high-quality audio transmission. The results suggested that audio signal quality is often overemphasized.
insight: Electrical properties, not material, determine quality of audio transmission

title: iFixIt calls BMW s new anti-consumer security screws 'a logo-shaped middle finger to right to repair,' Adafruit 3D prints a solution BMW's connector reverse engineered using patent filing as a design blueprint
summary: BMW's new security screws, designed to resemble its logo, have been criticized for hindering repair and service access. In response, Adafruit has 3D printed a solution using a reverse-engineered connector based on a patent filing. This move has sparked debate over the right to repair and consumer access to automotive parts.
insight: Gatekeeping design prioritizes profits over consumer repair rights

title: ENIAC, the world s first general-purpose digital computer, turns 80 years old today legendary hulking machine was 1,000x faster than its nearest rival
summary: ENIAC, the world's first general-purpose digital computer, was unveiled in 1946. It was 1,000 times faster than its nearest rival.
insight: Pioneering innovation set the stage for modern computing and technology advancements.

title: AMD Ryzen 7 9850X3D vs Ryzen 7 9800X3D faceoff an extra $30 buys you very little performance
summary: The Ryzen 7 9850X3D and Ryzen 7 9800X3D are compared in a comprehensive test. The results show that the Ryzen 7 9800X3D is a great option due to its high performance and lower price. An extra $30 does not significantly improve performance.
insight: Extra cost yields minimal performance gain in high-end gaming CPUs.

title: The Steam Deck is sold out, but the SteamOS-powered Legion Go S is still available for $50 off get Lenovo's handheld for $599
summary: Lenovo's Legion Go S offers better performance without Windows overhead, undercutting its original price with a limited-time $50 deal, making it available for $599.
insight: SteamOS alternative offers better gaming performance at lower cost.

title: Rapidus targets mass 2nm chip production in 2027, quadruples capacity ramp up company plans to scale to 25,000 wafer starts per month in just one year
summary: Rapidus plans 2nm chip production by 2027, with full-scale by 2028.
insight: Mass production of 2nm chips boosts global semiconductor competitiveness

title: Radeon RX 9060 XT 8GB defies the AI crunch and drops back to $299 MSRP Navi 44 throws a lifeline for budget gamers
summary: PowerColor's Reaper AMD Radeon RX 9060 XT 8GB is selling at its $299 MSRP, a rare sight in these times. This budget-friendly option is a lifeline for gamers struggling with high prices.
insight: Budget-conscious gamers can now access high-performance graphics at affordable prices.

title: Wi-Fi 7 promises made, but not kept the mysteries of MLO and AFC, and looking toward Wi-Fi 8
summary: Wi-Fi 7 has failed to meet expectations with fragmented technology and unfulfilled promises. The mysteries surrounding MLO (Multi-Link Operation) and AFC (Adaptive Frequency Control) have only added to the confusion. Wi-Fi 8 may not provide the clarity needed to move forward.
insight: Fragmented Wi-Fi technology hinders seamless connectivity and innovation

title: Steam to add hardware specs to reviews optional feature could help you dodge poorly optimized games
summary: Steam is introducing an optional feature to display hardware specs in reviews, allowing users to consider the reviewer's hardware when reading feedback. This feature aims to provide more context to other players considering a title. Valve emphasizes that this feature remains optional for users.
insight: Users can dodge poorly optimized games by considering reviewer's hardware specs.

title: Framework's latest update brings more bad news about memory and storage pricing crisis RAM costs increased to $12 to $16 per GB, recommends purchasing some models elsewhere for Framework Laptop DIY Edition customers
summary: Framework updated its laptop RAM prices to $12-$16 per GB, affecting DIY customers. The company will release a monthly update to monitor memory chip prices and maintain prices close to the weighted average cost. It recommends purchasing some models from alternative sources.
insight: RAM prices surge for Framework Laptop DIY Edition customers

title: Google reports that state hackers from China, Russia and Iran are using Gemini in 'all stages' of attacks phishing lures, coding and vulnerability testing get AI underpinnings from hostile actors
summary: Hackers from multiple countries are using Google's Gemini AI to aid their attacks, leveraging it for tasks such as generating phishing lures, translating text, coding, and vulnerability testing.
insight: Google's AI technology is being exploited by hostile actors for malicious purposes.

title: Asus ROG Crosshair X870E Dark Hero Motherboard Review
summary: Asus ROG Crosshair X870E Dark Hero is a high-end AMD motherboard with top-notch features and an all-black aesthetic.
insight: Premium AMD motherboard offers solid performance and sleek design options.

title: Twitch streamer uses electrodes to manipulate balance using electricity can be used to control a real-life human being with an Xbox controller or joystick, simulate racing game G-force
summary: Twitch streamer Perri Karyal uses electrodes to simulate G-forces, altering her balance. This device is used for Galvanic Vestibular Stimulation (GVS) in gaming. It can also be used to control a human being with a controller.
insight: Electrical stimulation can be used to control human movement

title: WD Green SN3000 1TB SSD Review: A diamond in the rough
summary: The WD Green SN3000 SSD surpasses expectations with its impressive performance, challenging the notion that value-oriented drives must sacrifice speed for affordability.
insight: Budget-friendly drives can offer exceptional performance without sacrificing quality.

title: Save $438 on a Ryzen 7 9850X3D, Asus X870, and 32GB of DDR5 RAM Newegg strikes with another blistering sub-$800 AM5 bundles
summary: Get a Ryzen 7 9850X3D bundle with motherboard and 32GB RAM for under $800.
insight: Affordable high-performance AMD bundles for PC enthusiasts available now.

title: OpenAI launches GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark on Cerebras chips marks AI giants first production deployment away from Nvidia
summary: OpenAI has released GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark on Cerebras chips, its first non-Nvidia production deployment.
insight: Diversification of AI hardware reduces reliance on single vendor.

title: Tachyum forced to shutter R&D office due to unpaid rent, wages, and taxes firm still claims forthcoming Prodigy chip will have a 21x performance leap on Nvidia Rubin Ultra
summary: Tachyum, a semiconductor company, has been forced to shut down its R&D office due to unpaid rent, wages, and taxes. Despite this setback, the firm claims its upcoming Prodigy chip will achieve a 21x performance increase over Nvidia's Rubin Ultra. The exact timeline for the Prodigy chip's release remains unclear.
insight: Financial instability undermines semiconductor firm's high-performance chip ambitions

title: Creality Falcon A1 Pro Review An easy-to-use, fully enclosed 20W laser engraver with a built-in HD camera
summary: The Creality Falcon A1 Pro is a user-friendly, fully enclosed laser engraver with a 20W blue laser and built-in HD camera, capable of engraving and cutting various materials at high speeds and precision.
insight: Enhanced precision and safety features for DIY laser engraving enthusiasts.

title: Android 17 Beta 1 released with H.266/VVC support, camera improvements, and more
summary: Android 17 Beta 1 is released with performance improvements, H.266/VVC support, and camera enhancements. This marks a change from previous Developer Previews, with the first release now being the Beta 1 version. The update also includes restrictions on large screen devices.
insight: Android 17 prioritizes performance and tablet compatibility above app flexibility.

title: STMicroelectronics Stellar P3E quad-core Arm Cortex-R52+ automotive MCU features Neural-ART AI accelerator
summary: STMicroelectronics has introduced the Stellar P3E automotive MCU, featuring a Neural-ART AI accelerator and quad-core Arm Cortex-R52+ cores. The MCU simplifies Electronic Control Units (ECUs) by consolidating powertrain functions into a single module. It enables smart sensing, predictive maintenance, and virtual sensor applications.
insight: Enables AI-driven automotive functionality in a single, cost-effective MCU solution.

title: Avalue EMX-PTLP A thin mini-ITX motherboard powered by up to an Intel Core Ultra 7 358H Panther Lake-H SoC
summary: The Avalue EMX-PTLP is a thin mini-ITX motherboard powered by Intel's Panther Lake-H processor, supporting up to 64GB of DDR5 memory and various connectivity options. It features a range of interfaces, including M.2, PCIe, HDMI, and USB ports, making it suitable for industrial automation and AI deployments. The board supports up to 180 TOPS for AI and industrial automation.
insight: High-performance computing for industrial automation and AI applications

title: Mimiclaw is an OpenClaw-like AI assistant for ESP32-S3 boards
summary: Mimiclaw is an AI assistant for ESP32-S3 boards inspired by OpenClaw, allowing users to control hardware through a chat interface with Telegram and online LLM. It's written in C and relies on the ESP-IDF 5.5 framework. Mimiclaw requires a specific ESP32-S3 board with 16 MB flash and 8 MB PSRAM.
insight: Microcontrollers can now utilize AI assistants for hardware control through messaging apps.

title: SlimeVR Butterfly Trackers nRF52833-based, ultra-slim, full-body VR trackers offer up to 48h battery life (Crowdfunding)
summary: The SlimeVR Butterfly Trackers offer ultra-slim, full-body VR tracking with up to 48 hours of battery life, using a custom 2.4 GHz ESB protocol and Nordic Semi's nRF52833 wireless MCU.
insight: Wireless, self-contained VR tracking eliminates base station and camera dependency.

title: de next-RAP8-EZBOX An ultra-compact, fanless or actively-cooled Intel Core i7-1365UE Raptor Lake embedded system
summary: The de next-RAP8-EZBOX is an ultra-compact embedded system with a powerful Intel Core i7-1365UE processor and various interfaces, suitable for space-constrained applications. It's available in fanless and actively cooled versions. The system features HDMI, Ethernet, and USB ports for connectivity.
insight: Industrial automation gains from high-performance, compact embedded computing solutions.

title: CHUWI CoreBook Air Plus 16 laptop review Part 1: Specs, unboxing, teardown, and first boot
summary: The CHUWI CoreBook Air Plus 16 is a laptop featuring a mid-range AMD Ryzen 5 6600H processor, 16GB of LPDDR5, and a 16-inch 1920x1200 display, with a detailed review covering specs, unboxing, teardown, and initial boot.
insight: Mid-range laptop offers competitive specs without breaking the bank.

title: Open Stack standalone 4G LTE IoT board runs RTOS on Quectel EC200U LTE module (Crowdfunding)
summary: Open Stack is a standalone 4G LTE IoT board that runs RTOS directly on the Quectel EC200U series LTE module, reducing power consumption, BOM cost, and physical footprint. It supports multi-band LTE, GNSS, Bluetooth, and various networking protocols. The board is suitable for various IoT applications without additional controller hardware.
insight: Simplifies IoT development with integrated LTE module and RTOS

title: ESP32 Marauder 5G Apex 5 module for Flipper Zero combines ESP32-C5, two Sub-GHz radios, nRF24, and GPS
summary: The ESP32 Marauder 5G Apex 5 Module is an upgrade for Flipper Zero, featuring ESP32-C5 dual-band capabilities and multiple radios, including WiFi, Sub-GHz, nRF24, and GPS, with enhanced storage and power management.
insight: Enhanced Flipper Zero capabilities for advanced hacking and penetration testing.

title: PiLink PL-R5/R5M Series IP20/IP65 Industrial PCs powered by Raspberry Pi CM5
summary: PiLink's PL-R5/R5M Series are compact industrial PCs powered by Raspberry Pi CM5, offering IP20 or IP65 protection and various configurations.
insight: Raspberry Pi-based industrial PCs bring affordability and flexibility to industrial applications worldwide.

title: VU GPSDR A low-cost GPS-disciplined SDR expansion board for the Vivid Unit RK3399 touchscreen SBC
summary: The UUGear VU GPSDR is a low-cost SDR expansion board designed for the Vivid Unit RK3399 SBC, featuring a GPS-disciplined clock and high frequency stability. It uses the RTL2832U ADC and Rafael Micro R860 tuner. The board also includes a u-blox NEO-M8N GPS module for accurate timing.
insight: High frequency stability at an affordable price for enthusiasts and developers.

title: PicoClaw ultra-lightweight personal AI Assistant runs on just 10MB of RAM
summary: PicoClaw is an ultra-lightweight AI assistant running on 10MB RAM, suitable for resource-constrained devices.
insight: Enabling AI on low-power, low-cost embedded boards for mass adoption.

title: Beelink ME Pro 2-bay Intel N95/N150 NAS and mini PC supports 5GbE networking, up to 3x M.2 MVMe SSDs
summary: Beelink ME Pro is a compact, 2-bay NAS and mini PC with Intel N95/N150 SoC, 5 GbE networking, and up to 3x M.2 NVMe slots. It features a DIY drawer design for upgrades and improved thermals. Target applications include home NAS, media server, and compact desktop PC.
insight: Compact, upgradable NAS and mini PC with enhanced networking capabilities.

title: TOPST D3-G maker SBC is powered by Telechips TCT8050 Dolphin3 Cortex-A72/A53/R5 automotive-grade SoC
summary: The TOPST D3-G is a single board computer powered by the Telechips TCT8050 Dolphin3 SoC, featuring a 9-core automotive-grade processor with high-performance capabilities.
insight: High-performance automotive-grade SBC with robust computing and graphics capabilities.

title: Black Sesame Technologies Wudang C1200 cross-domain automotive SoCs feature up to 10x Cortex-A78AE cores
summary: Black Sesame Technologies' Wudang C1200 SoCs support up to 10x Cortex-A78AE cores, designed for automotive-grade cross-domain computing platforms.
insight: Advanced safety and computing capabilities for autonomous driving systems.

title: Add a tiny desktop monitor to your PC with the ESP32 Desktop Monitor project
summary: A low-cost ESP32 board, TENSTAR T-Display, can be transformed into a tiny desktop monitor using the ESP32 Desktop Monitor project, allowing users to display PC content on a small 1.14-inch LCD.
insight: Low-cost, compact display solution for secondary PC monitoring.

title: Geniatech DB3506 is a full-featured Rockchip RK3506 development board and 3.5-inch industrial SBC
summary: Geniatech DB3506 is an industrial-grade development board with a Rockchip RK3506 SoC, offering various interfaces for IoT and HMI applications.
insight: Enables fast and efficient development of industrial IoT and HMI systems

title: Linux 6.19 Release Main changes, Arm, RISC-V, and MIPS architectures
summary: Linux 6.19 has been released with expected changes and no major surprises. The next kernel will be worked on with over 30 pull requests. Users outside the US may consider trying out the new kernel.
insight: Linux 6.19 brings expected updates to various architectures smoothly.

title: 86-type Smart Home control panel features a 3.5-inch display, physical buttons, Bluetooth SIG Mesh gateway
summary: The Tuya WiFi 3.5-inch Smart Center Control Panel features a hybrid approach with a capacitive touchscreen and physical buttons for smart homes. It includes a Bluetooth SIG Mesh gateway, Wi-Fi, and 3x independent relay channels. The device offers a combination of local and remote control for smart spaces.
insight: Hybrid interface enhances smart home control experience and accessibility.

title: 8devices Maca 2 A ultra-long-range data radio with 80km range for drones and robotics
summary: The 8devices Maca 2 is a high-power wireless data radio designed for ultra-long-range connectivity, suitable for applications such as drones, robotics, and IoT systems, featuring up to 80 km range and high transmit power.
insight: Enabling reliable, long-range communication for high-stakes drone and robotics applications

title: Texas Instruments unveils MSPM33C321A mixed-signal Cortex-M33 microcontroller with 256KB SRAM, 1MB flash
summary: Texas Instruments has unveiled the MSPM33C321A, a high-performance Cortex-M33 microcontroller featuring 256KB SRAM, 1MB flash, and a range of peripherals.
insight: Enhanced security and performance for industrial and IoT applications

title: Compact, fanless DIN-Rail Intel Core Ultra 5 235U/7 265U industrial PC targets AMR, robotics, and computer vision
summary: The ASUS IoT PE1000U is a compact, fanless DIN-rail industrial PC designed for AMR, robotics, and computer vision applications. It features an Intel Core Ultra 5 235U/7 265U processor, supporting SO-DIMM DDR5 memory, SATA and NVMe storage, and multiple I/O interfaces. The device operates in a wide temperature range and accepts a 9-36V DC power input.
insight: Enabling efficient, high-performance AI and vision processing in industrial environments.

title: $199+ M5Stack AI Pyramid Computing Box Linux AI mini PC is based on Axera AX8850 SoC
summary: M5Stack AI Pyramid Computing Box is an AI mini PC with an Axera AX8850 SoC, providing 24 TOPS NPU performance, 4GB or 8GB RAM, and multiple I/O options for Edge AI applications.
insight: Edge AI computing platform for systems and applications

title: Olimex HoT aims to be lightweight, easier-to-use alternative to Home Assistant
summary: Olimex HoT is a lightweight alternative to Home Assistant for smart home automation, designed to run on low-end hardware and interface with ESPHome nodes.
insight: Simplifying smart home automation for lower-end hardware users matters.

title: Review of XIAO ePaper DIY Kit EE02 13.3-inch color E-Ink display with SenseCraft HMI and Arduino
summary: The XIAO ePaper DIY Kit EE02 is a 13.3-inch color E-Ink display kit that combines an ESP32-S3 board with a Spectra 6 display, featuring Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and a USB Type-C port. The kit supports SenseCraft HMI and Arduino platforms for development. It also includes a charging circuit and user buttons for added functionality.
insight: Combining ESP32-S3 with E-Ink display for IoT and wearable applications.

title: Raspberry Pi 4 dual RAM variant introduced to mitigate RAM price increases and supply challenges
summary: Raspberry Pi introduces a dual RAM variant of the Raspberry Pi 4 to mitigate RAM price increases and supply challenges, offering flexibility in manufacturing and reducing costs.
insight: Mitigating RAM price increases with dual RAM variant flexibility.

title: Cubie A7S A compact Allwinner A733 SBC with USB-C DisplayPort, GbE, WiFi 6, PCIe Gen3 FFC connector, GPIO headers
summary: Radxa's Cubie A7S is a compact SBC featuring Allwinner A733 octa-core CPU, up to 16GB LPDDR5 memory, Gigabit Ethernet, and WiFi 6. It offers a balance between compact sizes and features, including USB-C DisplayPort and PCIe Gen3. The board caters to applications requiring a mix of performance and portability.
insight: Compact SBC bridges performance and portability needs

title: Texas Instruments to acquire Silicon Labs
summary: Texas Instruments acquires Silicon Labs for $7.5 billion, expanding its wireless offerings.
insight: Texas Instruments gains strategic wireless connectivity solutions through Silicon Labs acquisition.

title: AMD Kintex UltraScale+ Gen 2 mid-range FPGA family to be available until at least 2045
summary: AMD Kintex UltraScale+ Gen 2 is a mid-range FPGA family with high-speed transceivers and PCIe Gen4, offering increased memory bandwidth and advanced imaging capabilities for various industries.
insight: Long-term availability supports long-term design and deployment investments

title: Qualcomm IPQ5424 embedded router board supports 22 Gbps tri-band Wi-Fi 7 and dual 10GbE networking
summary: The Wallys Communications DR5424 is a high-performance embedded router board supporting tri-band Wi-Fi 7 connectivity up to 22 Gbps, along with dual 10GbE networking and various ports for debugging and expansion. The board is powered by the Qualcomm IPQ5424 SoC and targets applications such as Wi-Fi 7 access points and IoT gateways. It also features 4GB or 8GB DDR4 memory and multiple USB ports.
insight: Ultra-fast Wi-Fi 7 connectivity for next-gen IoT and network applications.

title: reComputer Jetson AGX Orin Developer Kit GMSL Bundle features 8x GMSL2 camera interfaces, 10GbE networking
summary: The reComputer Jetson AGX Orin Developer Kit GMSL Bundle is a compact, high-performance developer kit featuring 8 GMSL2 camera interfaces and 10GbE networking, ideal for edge AI applications.
insight: Enabling high-speed, multi-camera AI vision applications at the edge.
